job.title: Director of Engineering, Autolist
job.description: About AutolistFor most people, shopping for a vehicle is an experience we'd rather forget. Navigating a sea of endless options, spending hours, and the dealership and negotiating toe-to-toe with a dealer who does all this every day leaves automotive shoppers feeling exhausted and overwhelmed while hopeful, but not sure, they got a vehicle in good condition for a fair price.Autolist is on a mission to rewire the automotive industry by making it easier for everyone to find and get a vehicle they love! We are creating an automotive shopping experience for every stage of the automotive life cycle - buying, selling, owning - and we're well on our way. As an independent brand and subsidiary of CarGurus (NASDAQ: CARG) we're a startup within the worldwide category leader in automotive shopping helping millions of monthly users via our award-winning apps and web shopping platforms. Our efforts to streamline the automotive shopping experience is supported by a strong passion to empower people with the knowledge and experience they need for everything automotive, a dedication to equity, inclusion, and belonging, and world-class benefits.What You'll DoAs the Director of Engineering Manager at Autolist you will provide managerial and technical leadership in a lean, fast-paced, data-driven environment. You will be deeply engaged in the leadership of the company, our culture, product strategy, technical strategy, and more. You will work alongside our engineers and managers to deliver great products and support the full development lifecycle discovering, designing, developing, testing, deploying, maintaining, observing, and improving our software.You will own the success of our engineers in developing their careers as well as executing on products. You will be hands-on and collaborative with fellow engineers, analysts, designers, product, and business partners as you solve exciting problems with real impact at scale.This role will report to the General Manager of Autolist and be a member of the Autolist Leadership Team.ResponsibilitiesManage a growing organization with 3+ engineering managers and 15+ engineersLead recruiting efforts to thoughtfully grow the teamMentor and motivate the engineering team, contributing to the career development of othersLead the technical strategy and setting of standards, technical vision, and cultureSupport the teams to prioritize and scope engineering investmentsAssist in the delivery and maintenance of products: write code, perform code reviews, and define best practicesEliminate roadblocks, and make sure each team member has everything to achieve their full potentialActively drive the development of the Autolist culturePartner with product, business, and design teams to implement disruptive consumer featuresTake an active role in the day to day operations of the engineering teamOwn goals, deadlines, and be a partner in company-wide strategic planningKeep the team focused on the highest-impact tasks and projectsProvide an open and friendly line of communication for engineers to voice their success and concernsMake sure the engineers' experience at Autolist is a positive oneServe as a link between engineering, the executive team, and HR, to help the engineers be successfulInspire engineers to follow and refine best practicesWhat Success Looks LikeSuccess of Engineering direct reportsTimely and impactful delivery of products and projectsAchievement of company goals and objectivesThe growth and career development of Autolist engineersCommunicating with General Manager, engineering managers, and other related executives, and HR, early and often about engineers' successes and concernsDeveloper HappinessEnsuring our technology is built in a way that supports achieving our product and business goals in a timely manner, without putting an impractical burden on future development efforts.Who You AreResults-oriented, proven technical leader10+ years of software development experience4+ years of management experience2+ years managing engineering managersExpertise with both dynamic/interpreted (Javascript, Ruby, Python) and compiled (java, kotlin) languagesExperience with a modern Javascript framework like Next.js, React, ReduxPolyglot engineer comfortable with full stack web developmentStrong understanding of Postgres or similar relational databasesStrong understanding of ElasticsearchExperience maintaining Cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or equivalent) and familiarity with DevOps tools (Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, Ansible)Expertise in maintaining Kubernetes clustersUnderstanding of how to build high-performance web applicationsAble to conceptualize, develop, test, and release productDrawn to and thrive in a fast-paced environment that pushes high-quality code continuouslyAble to work independently, as well as collaborativelyNote: The requirements listed on this job description are guidelines not hard and fast rules. To excel in this role you will not need to satisfy or meet every requirement listed. If you have the transferable skills and want the opportunity to be considered – please apply!BonusHave worked in a pair-programming environmentAn interest in exploring code design and architectureHave used test-driven development (TDD) extensivelyExperience building consumer-facing applicationsExperience of working with the auto industryPractical experience of a range of agile development methodologiesExperience building metasearch productsSecurity chops (JWT, HMAC, CSP, cryptography)Performance chops (CWV, CRP, PWA, LnP)Android and/or iOS experienceM.S. or PhD in Computer Science or related fieldEqual Opportunity StatementAutolist is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that everyone should receive equal consideration and treatment. Recruitment, hiring, placements, transfers, and promotions will happen based on qualifications for the positions being filled regardless of sex, gender identity, race, religious creed, color, national origin ancestry, age, physical disability, pregnancy, mental disability, or medical condition.Check out this link to learn more about our engineering team: https://www.autolist.com/engineering
